content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
This game is a maze-style action puzzle with a mix of combat and exploration. You control an avatar who can shoot a sword projectile, navigate corridors, and interact with key objects in a level that seems to be built like a dungeon or building with walls and corridors.

Key points of the game:

• Genre & Mechanics
 – It’s a grid‐based maze or dungeon crawler where you explore a confined level. 
 – The rules mix puzzle elements (finding and using keys to open doors) with real‐time action (dodging and shooting enemies).
 – The avatar can shoot a sword projectile (with a set frame rate) that can defeat enemies, and there is an emphasis on using the sword effectively.
 – Enemies (including monsters that wander at different speeds) roam the maze; they move randomly, adding uncertainty to your path.

• Objective
 – Your primary mission is to collect a key and then reach the door (the “goal”). 
 – At first, your avatar appears as “nokey,” which, upon interacting with a key, transforms you into a “withkey” state. Only then can you successfully trigger the door.
 – The door (or goal) is the exit that wins you the level when activated correctly after picking up the key.

• Win/Loss Conditions
 – You win by having a “goal” sprite appear (meaning you met the condition of going through the door with the key).
 – You lose if your avatar is removed from play (for instance, if you collide with an enemy on your own, which not only decreases your score but also can be lethal).

• Overall Strategy
 – First, explore the maze to locate the key. Be sure to transform your avatar from “nokey” to “withkey” so you’re ready for the exit.
 – Watch out for roaming enemies. Since bumping into them results in a negative score (and may eventually lead to your death), it’s wise to either avoid them or use your sword to clear your path.
 – Since your avatar can shoot, take calculated shots to eliminate hostile enemies from a safe distance. Different enemies have varying movement speeds (quick, normal, and slow), so adjust your timing accordingly.
 – Navigate the level’s corridors and avoid dead ends. Plan a route that minimizes enemy encounters on your way to the door.
 – Use the environment (walls and obstacles) to block enemy movement if possible and manage your shot timing, given that your sword has a flickering limit (only available briefly).
 – Finally, once you have the key and you’re in “withkey” form, head toward the door to win the level, ensuring that you don’t get caught by enemy patrols along the way.

In summary, approach the game as a tense but strategic puzzle where quick reflexes are balanced with careful planning: grab the key, dispatch or dodge enemies smartly using your projectile sword, and head to the door to complete the level.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.

Action:4

I'm moving down from my current position at (row3, col1) into (row4, col1) where the key is located, expecting to pick it up and transform my avatar to the withkey state as per the rules.

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
floor goal -> 'g'
floor key -> '+'
floor nokey -> 'A'
floor monsterQuick -> '1'
floor monsterNormal -> '2'
floor monsterSlow -> '3'
wall -> 'w'
floor -> '.'
goal -> '@'
key -> '#'
monsterNormal -> '$'
monsterQuick -> '%'
monsterSlow -> '&'
nokey -> '*'
withkey -> 'm'
